main event: A group of witnesses observed a bright, oblong-shaped light above Bald Eagle Ridge in Pennsylvania for about 15 minutes on March 17, 1967.
interesting points: The light appeared stationary for most of the observation period,It flashed rapidly and split into two lights at one point,The original light did not diminish in brightness during the splitting,The light gradually dimmed before finally disappearing rather than turning off suddenly,The witnesses had no drugs or alcohol before the observation, ensuring clarity of perception.
witness description: Both witnesses were traveling in an automobile, with one passenger aged 25 sitting in the front.
